title: To Do Physics, You Need to Believe in an Objective Reality PLUS a Look at Constructor Theory
description:
Glen and Karen discuss Truth and Reality. Do they inhabit the same space? Also Creativity, Trust networks and Constructor Theory.
Re the JBP clip video on Truth, he says creativity requires you to be "tied" to the truth.
Glen mentions Nima Arkani Hamed's view of truth, always beyond our reach, but the search for truth requires a searching moral inventory.
To do physics, you have to believe there is an objective reality.
Lifestyle disciplines are needed to approach the truth.
Cesar Hidalgo on Google Talks "Why Information Grows".

Opportunity cost - limitations
Consequences - constraints
Collective unconsciousness OR distributed cognition?
Robust trust networks tend to correlate to thriving economies.
Are we partners in His creative effort?
Rules are there to help us be creative. 10 commandments
Discipline leads to peace.
"Thou shalt not bear witness against thy neighbor," not only means not to lie, but that if you bear false witness, you are putting mistrust out into the community and you can no longer trust the shared world.
A trust network requires that truth is in the system.

Arguments from stability - you can't have a rational morality code.
Dawkins  - nature chooses stability over efficiency
Society is unstable in violence or threats of violence - even one person can cause this instability.
Christ's death inoculated them from fear.
In the case of radon, small amounts of exposure actually inoculate people over time, but too much radon had negative consequences.

Constructor Theory - an effort to put physics on an axiomatic basis, similar to what Godel was trying to do with Math.
Constructor theory asks, What can be done in physics? What is possible/impossible.
What is allowed but not derivable from first principles in an axiomatic/mathematics sense.
Complicated things are just a bunch of simple things put together.
Inside is the complexity, Outside you are only dealing with a handful of details.

Each layer hides the complexity from the next layer up.

The creative process is, "I'm missing something, there's something I need to focus on, go back and look again."
The discipline that looks to see where the patterns are showing up.
Ability to recognize patterns - overlaying patterns - condensed matter - quasi particles.

Music, math, art, truth - discovered or invented?

Also, Glen and I did a six part series on the beginning of life. Here's the playlist:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLoARw9zo4EUZhxqfaqYU5yjy0-Tr8RlB4
